Centrifugation also seems to work on neon crystals. They consist largely of simple silicon crystal, but tiny, luminous structures still remain...
Upon closer analysis, it appears to be an extremely rare, extremely volatile atom called bitripentium that is stabilized by a silicate shell.
I can apply this to all crystal types, but I first must grind them to dust.
